alert.note: Alert for City of Manassas; City of Manassas Park; Fauquier; Prince William; Stafford (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 25 at 3:50PM EDT until July 25 at 4:30PM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: The National Weather Service in Sterling Virginia has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northeastern Stafford County in northern Virginia... East central Fauquier County in northern Virginia... The central City of Manassas Park in northern Virginia... Prince William County in northern Virginia... The City of Manassas in northern Virginia... * Until 430 PM EDT. * At 350 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Bull Run to 9 miles east of Bealeton, moving southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Damaging winds will cause some trees and large branches to fall. This could injure those outdoors, as well as damage homes and vehicles. Roadways may become blocked by downed trees. Localized power outages are possible. Unsecured light objects may become projectiles. * Locations impacted include... Dale City, Woodbridge, Quantico, Lake Ridge, Linton Hall, Montclair, Lorton, Bull Run, Triangle, Dumfries, Manassas, Sudley, Cherry Hill, Manassas Park, Independent Hill, Mason Neck, Nokesville, Occoquan, Catlett and Widewater. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Large hail and damaging winds and continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning.

area.areaDesc: City of Manassas; City of Manassas Park; Fauquier; Prince William; Stafford
